Human Resources Department Manual

Overview

HR at Driscoll Foods is led by Samantha Giordano and consists of four team members

The department handles payroll, employee complaints, hiring, injuries, compliance, and all personnel documentation.

Neutrality, confidentiality, and professionalism are always essential.

A lot of the job is unanticipated and spontaneous.

Team Structure

Samantha Giordano – HR Lead overseeing payroll, incentives, investigations, interviews, injuries, compliance, and invoice cleaning.

Team Members (4) – Support with tracking, reporting, onboarding, filing, and communication across Operations and other departments.

Payroll & Incentives

Mondays: major payroll and timecard review day.

Only certain HR members have access to timecards, PTO, sick days, and incentive logs.

Driscoll employees can be verified in Paychex; Stonehill agency hires require manual entry.

Tuesday: incentives must be completed by noon.

Fridays: high volume of payroll questions from employees.

HR updates spreadsheets for incentives, bonuses, hourly pay, and corrections.

Employee Communication

HR must speak clearly and patiently with employees.

Samantha asks many clarifying questions to understand issues fully.

Explanations must be simple and easy for all employees to understand.

HR prioritizes poise, patience, and accuracy in communication.

Attendance Tracking & Write‑Ups

Nayeli reviews the Night Shift Recap from Kudjoe every morning.

Tracks absences, reasons, and notes if employees are in their first 90 days using Paychex.

Reviews Dispatch Sheet from Delareese for absent drivers

Updates the Ops Attendance Tracker with offense numbers.

Maintains the Write-Up Tracker and uploads related documents to employee Paychex files.

Documentation & Records

HR maintains individual employee folders with onboarding documents, write-ups, agreements, and reports.

Job applications are received through Indeed.

Non-operations applications are forwarded to Sam Cuesta to pass to department heads.

HR depends on documentation from Transportation and Ops to complete reports and verification processes.

Bereavement & Loan Policy

Paid bereavement leave applies to parents, in-laws, siblings, and grandparents.

Loan repayment agreements are tracked; employees who quit must repay within 7 days

Loan requests are assessed using hire date, balance owed, attendance, and write-up history.

Injury Handling & Workers Compensation

All injuries must be reported immediately.

HR completes an injury report and confirms if the employee wants medical attention (Concentra or CityMD).

Workers Comp insurance is through Sentry.

HR emails incident details to Sentry and the broker to receive a claim number.

Employees must miss 7+ days to receive Workers Comp benefits.

HR tracks all incidents in the Log of Work-Related Illnesses or Injuries for annual submission to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

HR must investigate injuries thoroughly to confirm validity and prevent unnecessary liability.

Hiring Process

HR reviews Indeed applications daily.

Conducts phone screenings in English or Spanish using prepared question prompts.

Screenings last ~4 minutes to determine if an in-person interview is needed.

In-person interviews include a warehouse test (electric jack operation).

HR evaluates applicant experience, skill, professionalism, and fitness.

Compliance & Legal Requirements

HR must follow labor laws and internal company policies.

FMLA allows eligible employees 12 weeks of job-protected leave.

All terminations must be reported to the Department of Labor within 7 days.

HR must investigate all complaints and allegations—none can be dismissed without review.

Confidentiality is always required.

Thursday Check Distribution

HR receives Operations checks on Thursday.

Checks are scanned for documentation and sorted by order.

Breakdown is created by Sam Cuesta.

Managers distribute checks Thursday night or Friday morning.

Daily Workflow

HR balances structured tasks (payroll, trackers, incentive logs) with unpredictable events such as injuries, complaints, and employee requests.
Organization and adaptability are crucial to maintaining efficiency and compliance.
